intro: Dortmanna palustris, commonly known as the marsh dock, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as pond margins and damp meadows. The plant has basal leaves that are broad and lobed, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods that mature in late summer. Dortmanna palustris plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
